intro: Geissorhiza quinquangularis var. atrofaux, commonly known as the black-flowered geissorhiza, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, dark violet to black flowers. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, rhizomatous stem. It typically blooms in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique coloration and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
